Synchronous Lecture

WebEx

Record WebEx sessions

Recording sessions can aid students with ADHD who have difficulty focusing during lecture and need to re-watch content.

    Step 1: At the beginning of the video session, go to the top menu bar, click on Meeting and then hover over Recorder Settings to select the location of where to save the session recording.



    Step 2: Go to the control bar at the bottom of the window and select Record.



    Step 3: Navigate to www.webex.com and log into your account. Go to the Recordings tab to view and download your recorded meeting.



Create WebEx lecture transcript

Students that are deaf or hard of hearing, struggle with audio-lectures. Also, students with ADHD may have difficulty focusing during as a syncronous lecture. Creating a transcript from a synchronous lecture can aid these students.

    Step 1: Navigate to www.webex.com and log into your account. Go to the Preferences tab on the left hand side menu.



    Step 2: Select the Recording tab in the Preferences window.



    Step 3: Click the checkbox for the option to 'Create recording transcripts for all my MP4 recordings'.

Bongo

Deliver live captions in Bongo Virtual Classroom

Students with ADHD and hearing disabilities have difficulty focusing and hearing the lecturer during a synchronous lecture. Delivering live captions significantly improves their learning experience.

    Step 1: Promote a user to Moderator. The person that will be typing live captions needs to have the Moderator role. If you scheduled the meeting and entered first, you may be automatically given the Moderator role.

    Step 2: As Moderator, enable captions for typing by clicking on the Closed Captions button on the left-hand side of the interface.



    Step 3: Then, click the button to enable captions for the meeting.



    Step 4: Once live captions have been enabled for the meeting, anyone who wants to view them must enable them, by clicking the button in the lower left corner. This will reveal a window where viewers can choose from several font and color options for their captions.




    Step 5: Type your live captions. When the Moderator and viewers have both enabled captions, any words the moderator types in the captions entry field will appear on the screen for viewers.



Record Bongo Virtual Classroom session

Recording sessions can aid students with ADHD who have difficulty focusing during lecture and need to re-watch content.

    Step 1: If your meeting is not automatically recording, click the text "Start recording" at the top of the screen. When recording is in progress, you will see the elapsed recording time and a red recording circle at the top of the screen.



    Step 2: To pause or stop recording, you can click the red recording icon again.

Microsoft PowerPoint

Present with real-time, automatic captions in PowerPoint

Transcribing your words as you present and displaying them on-screen as captions can help students understand the lecture more clearly and accommodate students who may be deaf or hard of hearing.

    Step 1: On the Slide Show ribbon tab, select the checkbox that says Always Use Subtitles.


    Step 2: In the Subtitle Settings menu, set the desired position of the captions or subtitles. They can appear over the top or bottom margin of the slide (overlaid), or they can appear above the top or below the bottom of the slide (docked). The default setting is Below Slide.


    Step 3: Speak clearly into the microphone and the real-time captions should appear on the screen for your students to read while you present.
